	Responsible for the Service Quality and Delivery of the Drilled &amp; Completed wells on time, depth, and budget.

	Strong decision-making capability

	Collaborative and team-oriented
	Commitment to safety and operational excellence.

Risk and Compliance Supervisor Job at Beta Glass




        
    

        
        Beta Glass, a proud member of the Frigoglass Group, stands as a strategic partner to international beverage bottlers. Positioned as a major supplier of glass packaging, we play a crucial role in the burgeoning markets of West and Central Africa.

Our diverse range of glass containers offers superior packaging solutions to clients across various sectors, including soft drinks, beer, spirits, cosmetics, and pharmaceuticals. We are committed to delivering excellence in our products. At Beta Glass, we are not just suppliers; we are partners in progress, dedicated to setting new standards in the glass packaging industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Risk and Compliance Supervisor
     

            
    



Job Location: Delta
Job Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	To support the effective identification, assessment, monitoring, and reporting of operational, financial, and compliance risks, and to promote a strong culture of compliance, internal control, and corporate governance across plant operations.


Responsibilities


	Identify, assess, and monitor operational, financial, and compliance risks at the plant level.
	Maintain an up-to-date plant risk register and track the implementation of agreed mitigation actions.
	Monitor compliance with company policies, procedures, and applicable regulatory requirements.
	Follow up on the closure of audit, risk, and internal control findings, ensuring timely remediation and proper documentation.
	Conduct spot checks and compliance reviews on high-risk processes and report observations to Head Office.
	Support the implementation of enterprise risk management, internal control, and fraud prevention policies at the plant.
	Escalate significant or emerging risk and compliance issues promptly to the Risk & Compliance Manager.
	Prepare and submit monthly risk and compliance status reports to Head Office.
	Facilitate employee awareness and training sessions on compliance, ethics, internal controls, and governance.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor's Degree or Higher National Diploma (HND) in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, Risk Management, Law or any other related disciplines
	4-6 years of experience
	Relevant experience in risk management, compliance, internal audit, or internal control, preferably within a manufacturing or regulated environment
	Report writing and documentation skills
	Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
	Strong analytical, communication, problem-solving skills with attention to details and interpersonal skills

Store Specialist Job at Beta Glass




        
    

        
        Beta Glass, a proud member of the Frigoglass Group, stands as a strategic partner to international beverage bottlers. Positioned as a major supplier of glass packaging, we play a crucial role in the burgeoning markets of West and Central Africa.

Our diverse range of glass containers offers superior packaging solutions to clients across various sectors, including soft drinks, beer, spirits, cosmetics, and pharmaceuticals. We are committed to delivering excellence in our products. At Beta Glass, we are not just suppliers; we are partners in progress, dedicated to setting new standards in the glass packaging industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Store Specialist
     

            
    



Job ID: 0076
Job Location: Agbara, Ogun
Job Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	This position is responsible for effective issuance of all materials (consumables, engineering spares, and equipment etc) to achieve documentation of receipt and processing of bills while items delivered without LPO are tracked accordingly.


Responsibilities


	Maintain stock control: the self-assured receipt against LPOs, storage, and timely documentation.
	Ensure good Inventory management- checking reorder level and ensure timely placement of requisition for replenishment.
	Minimize the level of Stock Shrinkage and maintain accurate and detailed records of all stock movements both into and out of the Store.
	Check all stocks received into and going out of the stores to ensure accurate records are kept
	Ensure respective user departmental inspection of incoming materials and obtain certification before receipt of same into the Store
	Maintain an up-to-date register and ensure tracker for materials on 'returnable and non-returnable basis’.
	Ensure 100% shelf visibility and rack compliance by good manufacturing practice and ensure Safety Storage principles are followed.
	Maintaining an up to date LOL Indent Register and produce regular reports and statistics as required
	Ensure prompt documentation of materials/items receipt by generating SRVs and dispatch same with suppliers' invoice(s).
	Full participation in all stock count activities (pre-stock and regular) and ensure all variances are resolved timely.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor's Degree or Higher National Diploma (HND) in Electrical/Mechanical Engineering, Logistics, Business Administration, Supply Chain or any other related disciplines
	1-3 years of experience in a similar position
	Sound knowledge of ERP, Warehouse and Storekeeping
	Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
	Strong analytical, communication, problem-solving skills with attention to details and interpersonal skills.

        Med-In Pharmaceutical Limited, a producer, manufacturer and seller of intravenous infusion, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Financial Officer

Job Location: Sagamu Interchange, Ogun

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Financial Strategy & Planning: Develop long-term financial plans, set financial goals, and advise on capital structure (debt/equity).

	Cost of Goods Sold (COGS): Deep dive into production costs, inventory valuation, and supply chain finance.
	Capital Expenditure (CapEx): Evaluate investments in new machinery, facilities, and technology.

	Candidates should possess a BSc / HND in Accounting with 15 years of experience.
